mixAR 0.22.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

mixAR 0.22.0

  • changed names of mixXXX classes to MixXXX.

mixAR 0.21.1

  • numerous other changes not recorded in this file.

  • Edited code for obs_info_matrix.R and mix_se. The function that calculates standard errors is now one, able to handle cases with fix/non-fix shift and, seasonal/non-seasonal models.

  • Edited functions: Bayesian analysis to handle more input errors (i.e. mostly to write tests), [] and [[ methods for raggedCoefV.

  • Written tests for Bayesian functions, added tests for mix_se() and raggedCoefS, written tests for raggedCoefV (incomplete).

@Georgi: When I test mix_se with the IBM data and fix_shift = FALSE, the model is nearly degenerate, as one component only gets 2 observations assigned and its variance is practically equal to 0 (order of 10^-30). I think this is what causess NaNs. I decided to use the lynx data to test fix_shift = FALSE. I found out that results in the Wong and Li paper are inaccurate, since if I enter their estimates and then re-fit the model with fit_mixAR, the MLEs are different from theirs. Since they are not MLEs, their estimates also cause error in calculating standard errors, therefore I used those for one of the tests. When I use the fitted MLEs and fix_shift = FALSE everything works fine.

mixAR 0.21.0

  • added the data for the portfoliio paper as dataset PortfolioData1. For now the dataset is internal, so needs to be accessed as mixAR:::PortfolioData1. In tests of course it can just be used as PortfolioData1.

  • created directory ./data-raw for source descriptions and code creating datasets, as suggested by usethis. Use usethis::use_data() and usethis::use_data_raw() to add datasets.

  • copied here most functions and documentation from package =“mixARsim”=, version 0.0.4, leaving out the ones that seem obsolete. There are some time consuming examples which may have to be shortened here, see =“Org/mixARsim.org”= and “NEWS.md” in package =“mixARsim”=.

  • changed all uses of ibmclose in examples and checks to fma::ibmclose, since data(ibmclose, package = "fma") doesn’t work with the recent version 2.4 of “fma”.

  • in the example for mix_se, added fix_shift = TRUE, since otherwise most of the standard errors are NaN’s. I also removed the expected results (a copy of them is in the tests, see “test-mix_se.R”.

    TODO: this needs further look. Note that the test in “test-mix_se.R” was using this argument, that’s why it was producing the expected results.

    Ah, Davide’s commit 3eaf2b07ce7d3fe564d2605df70be371a0d501a1 has changed “mix_se”. Apparently this lead to change of the default.

    @Davide: have you tested fix_shift = FALSE? In such cases it is a good idea to add examples, if not tests. In any case, add an entry to NEWS.md (this file).

  • removed mix_nindex() for “MixComp” objects, use nrow() instead.

  • In the version number now use only dots as separators.

  • now importing only selected objects from package “fGarch”, not everything.

  • stopped exporting set_parameters(), use parameters<-() instead.

  • removed “new.R”, after moving the remaining stuff to more appropriate places (mainly “mixAR.org”).

  • added further examples to mix_moment() based on file “ex1.Rhistory” and removed “ex1.Rhistory”.

mixAR 0.20-8

  • created _pkgdown.yml for a pkgdown web site. The docs/ folder is not tracked on bitbucket but we can create it locally and open docs/index.html in the browser. This is the first iteration of _pkgdown.yml, we should strive to keep it up-to-date and improve it.

  • small tinkering with R code. When editing S4 classes and method, updating to current recommended syntax.

  • extensive editing and cleanup of the documentation.

  • created Org files for Davide’s code.

  • I am gradually updating the Org files. For functions in .R files, generated by Org files (almost all are now generated this way), the main (developer) documentation is in the corresponding Org file or its rendered version (currently pdf). For well documented functions in the Rd documentation, the documentation is not repeated in the org file.

    This work is not complete yet.

  • The documentation of a number of functions mainly useful for developers now has the keyword ‘internal’ and so doesn’t appear in the pdf manual, see also the above remark.

mixAR 0.20-7

  • removed str(object) from show() methods for raggedCoef and raggedCoefS (these were probably leftovers from testing).

  • stopped exporting moWLxxx and related objects (they will be removed in due course). Now all models related to Wong Li (2002) are in exampleModels, see names(exampleModels) The are tests that check that the models in exampleModels are identical to the corresponding separate objects.

mixAR 0.20-6

  • Davide incorporated the MCMC and other stuff in the package.

  • made Davide co-author.

mixAR 0.20-5

  • incorporated Davide’s mix_se() function and methods.

  • moved function pseudoInverse() to package gbutils.

  • start switching setClass() declarations to the ones recommended in recent versions of R.

  • the new (unexported) environment devel_envir is a quick replacement for some respectie variables in the global environment. that were used in emGaussian.R to store information from optimisation procedures. (this is a quick replacement of what was already in emGaussian.R, a more complete functionality may be added, if needed.

  • lastn is exported again to avoid breaking old scripts and Rnw documents.

  • now stdnormmoment(), stdnormabsmoment(), stdtmoment(), stdtabsmoment() and tabsmoment() treat consistently corner cases and are better docummented. (These functions compute moments and absolute moments of standardised distributions.)

  • New variable exampleModels contains a number of models for examples and testing. This replaces moWL, moWL_A, and similar, which are still available but eventually will be removed.

mixAR 0.20-4

  • Now produce references using Rdpack.

  • Moved plotpdf() and cdf2q() to package gbutils (they are not specific to mixAR models).

  • stopped exporting extend_index()

mixAR 0.20-3

  • First changes since December 2012.

  • Cleaned up to remove most WARNINGs and NOTEs from ‘R CMD check’.

  • Refined somewhat import/depends and NAMESPACE.

  • Created directory Org and started moving code to it.

  • Now functions are exported selectively (i.e. not with the default parttern).

  • ragged2char() is no longer exported. Its documentation is kept in “ragged.Rdsav” in case I reconsider.)

  • lastn() is no longer exported.

  • File “mixAR/inst/tests/test_ragged.R” has been removed. The tests in that file are now incorporated in “raggedCoef.org” and exported as proper testthat tests.

mixAR 0.20-2

  • last version from 2012.

Developed by Georgi N. Boshnakov, Davide Ravagli.
